official-title.#text:
Supporting the goals and ideals of
		  Professional Social Work Month and World Social Work Day.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Education and the
			 Workforce

cosponsor.#text:
Ms. Michelle Lujan Grisham of New
			 Mexico

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the following
			 resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text:
supports the goals and ideals of
			 Professional Social Work Month and World Social Work Day;

encourages the
			 people of the United States to engage in appropriate ceremonies and activities
			 to promote further awareness of the life-changing role which social workers
			 play; and

recognizes with
			 gratitude the contributions of the millions of caring individuals who have
			 chosen to serve their communities through social work.

Whereas social workers make a critical impact in
			 adolescent and youth development, aging and family caregiving, child protection
			 and family services, health care navigation, mental and behavioral health
			 treatment, military and veterans assistance, nonprofit management and community
			 development, and poverty reduction;

Whereas March is recognized as Professional Social Work
			 Month and World Social Work Day is recognized on March 20, 2013: Now,
			 therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 118 IH: Supporting the goals and ideals of Professional Social Work Month and World Social Work Day.
